title: Inama 2016 Vin Soave  (Soave Classico)
description: This opens with delicate orchard fruit, citrus zest and white spring flower scents. On the bright palate, a bitter almond note accents ripe pear and nectarine flavors that are tangy with acidity.

title: Inspire Moore 2014 Truth Merlot-Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: This concentrated blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc is anchored elegantly by a backbone of crisp red-currant acidity. It's an herbal, fresh red framed by firm fine-grained tannins. The finish is lean and lingering.

title: Zuani 2014 Riserva White (Collio)
description: Pressed acacia flower, moist earth and aromatic herb scents mingle with fresh orchard fruit ntoes. The vibrant, ethereal palate is spare and subtle, offering yellow apple, tangy citrus and toasted nut nuances, with racy acidity.

title: Wellington 2012 Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Tart cherry and cranberry flavors form a core of richly round fruit and texture in this late-released wine, which exudes both power and finesse.

title: Wellington 2013 Victory Reserve Red (Sonoma County)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec make up the bulk of this blend, which is thick with dusty mocha and blackberry jam flavors. Medium bodied, it shows its crisp acidity on the finish.

title: Trivento 2016 Amado Sur White (Mendoza)
description: Buttercup and tropical fruit aromas are related to the 80% Torrontés in this blend (Viognier and Chardonnay are 10% each). This is plump but also high in acidity. Salty flavors of tropical fruits and pink grapefruit are retained on the finish.

title: Terrazze dell'Etna 2015 Rosato Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Made from 100% Nerello Mascalese, this has delicate McIntosh apple, white pepper and eucalyptus scents. Fresh acidity balances raw red cherry, orange peel and clove flavors on the straightforward palate.

title: Coffele 2016 Cà Visco  (Soave Classico)
description: Elderflower, honeydew melon and tropical fruit aromas lift out of the glass in this Soave. It's bright and fruity, offering creamy white peach and tangy pink grapefruit flavors, with a hint of candied tangerine and zesty acidity.

title: Criterion 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Grapy oaky aromas of blackberry and baked plum include a note of prune. This is full and dense in feel, with blackberry, prune and chocolate flavors. A grapy finish is chewy, a bit tannic, and roasted in flavor.

title: Center 38 North 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County)
description: This serviceable, affordable wine is dull on the nose yet highlighted with deep black fruit, toasted oak and graphite on the palate. Its rounded texture adds richness.

title: Dell'Angelo 2015  Greco di Tufo
description: Intensely floral aromas of pressed flower, overripe orchard fruit and Mediterranean brush lead the nose. On the palate, fennel and bitter almond accents back up yellow apple skin and mineral flavors. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

title: Domaine de Joÿ 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A rich perfumed style of wine that is both full of herbal flavors and crisp with minerality. It has a riper tropical edge with hints of pineapple. The aftertaste is crisp and fruity, ready to drink.

title: Château de Berne 2016 Pur Provence Unique Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Packed in a white bottle, more reminiscent of gin than wine, this is statement wine. The wine is just rosé, so pale as to be almost white. The result is a loss of some of the fruit flavors although the crispness and acidity remain. Drink now.

title: Château des Bertrands 2014 White (Côtes de Provence)
description: Even after three years, this light wine still tastes young. It has all the crispness of a brand new wine, only just mitigated by the soft texture and the hint of almonds. Drink the wine now.

title: Château Lastours 2014 Red (Gaillac)
description: This wine straddles the two seas: the Atlantic and Mediterranean with its blend of Bordeaux grapes with Syrah and Braucol. It is juicy and with bright red-berries, considerable acidity and a firm touch of tannin at the end. Drink now.

title: Vista Hills 2014 Treehouse Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine seems to be quickly maturing. Scents of rose petals and cherries carry over into similar flavors, punctuated with a light dusting of cocoa powder. There's ample acidity, and the wine is completely ready for near-term drinking.

title: Wagner 2016 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: More mineral than fruit, this delicately concentrated rosé offers glimpses of tart cherry and citrus flavor augmented by a backbone of fresh acidity. It's invigorating and spry with a lean dry finish.

title: Armstrong Family 2014 Petit Verdot (Yakima Valley)
description: The definition of 100% varietal, this wine brings bright aromas of fresh cranberries along with herbs and rose hips. Tart full cranberry flavors follow, with burly dry tannins backing them up. It needs some food to bring the tannins in check.

title: Ascension Cellars 2014 Trinity Red (Paso Robles)
description: The nose of this blend of 75% Grenache, 15% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre is jubilant yet not overly complex, with red cherry, thyme and pepper notes. The palate is equally yielding, with fruit punch and bubblegum flavors enhanced with herbal spice.

title: Barnard Griffin 2016 Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Electric pink in color, the aromas are light, with notes of cherry, strawberry and herb. It drinks dry with tart elegant fruit flavors that linger.

title: Bocopa 2015 Laudum Barrica Especial Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Herbal aromas of tobacco and grass are light and spicy, reminiscent of Cabernet Sauvignon. A rubbery pinchy palate improves with airing, while this tastes of roasted black fruits and tomato. Herbal peppery chocolaty flavors are nice on the finish.

title: Tasca d'Almerita 2016 Sallier de la Tour Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Ripe yellow peach, honeydew melon and exotic fruit scents follow through to the lively palate. Zesty acidity leaves a tangy finish.

title: Red Puro 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Oily citrus aromas offer side notes of air freshener and apricot. This atypical Chardonnay feels creamy and full, with mild acidity. Floral buttery leesy white-fruit flavors finish a bit soft. Drink now before it loses more steam.

title: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Bio Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: This straightforward white has subdued aromas suggesting citrus and pear. On the fresh, simple palate, a hint of brine adds interest to apple and lemon zest flavors.

title: Tikal 2014 Patriota Malbec-Bonarda (Uco Valley)
description: Heavy oak, like the kind you get in a sawmill, is the opening on this Malbec-Bonarda blend, and that's supported by grapy aromas. Saturated, rough and bulky on the palate, this features massively spiced, lavishly oaked berry flavors that lead to a banging finish with scraping tannins.

title: Second Growth 2015 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Light and simple fruit brings flavors of black-cherry hard candy with a dash of cola. It's a perfectly pleasant style, quaffable and uncomplicated. Drink now and over the next two or three years.

title: Prime Solum 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This syrupy, dense red exhibits tobacco and root beer flavors, framed with chunky tannins. Blackberry and black current fruit barely show through its leathery texture and profound weight.

title: Quilt 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is the first Cabernet Sauvignon release from Meomi founder Joe Wagner. Sourced from vineyards across the appellation, it shows simple yet focused dark cherry and chocolate flavors, dusty tannin and subtle oak, within a framework of moderate acidity and ripeness.

title: Echo Bay 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Light to medium in body, crisp and grassy in style, this is a solid choice for the money. Pineapple and passion fruit peek through the herbal overtones. Drink now.

title: Esperanza 2016 Estate Grown and Bottled White (Rueda)
description: Lemon and tangerine aromas are slightly dusty. In the mouth, this Viura-Verdejo combo is lively and bouncy. Pithy citrus, almond-skin and apple flavors finish juicy.
